required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: E-health Interventions to Promote Physical Activity Among Inactive Adults
clinical_study.official_title: E-health Interventions to Promote Physical Activity Among Inactive Adults: a Hybrid Type I Effectiveness-implementation Randomized Controlled Trial

collaborator.agency: UiT The Arctic University of Norway
Norwegian University of Science and Technology

brief_summary.textblock:
The project addresses physical inactivity as a global health issue. Physical inactivity is the fourth leading risk factor for global mortality. Moreover, inactive adults have a higher risk to develop lifestyle diseases. To date, there is preliminary evidence of the efficacy in the use of certain strategies including fitness technologies and digital interventions for physical activity (PA) promotion. Intervention studies are needed to test the effectiveness of PA promotion strategies.
A Hybrid Type I effectiveness-implementation randomised controlled trial (RCT) will investigate the effects of 1) fitness trackers, 2) home-based online training, and 3) peer support via social media among inactive adults. The design will allow testing the study outcomes while gathering information on implementation in a real-world situation. The study will produce evidence on whether these interventions increase the levels of PA among inactive adults and improve health outcomes. Increased PA will also result in better primary prevention of lifestyle diseases.

primary_outcome.description: Time spent in moderate to vigorous physical activity

secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of participants reaching the recommendation for physical activity

secondary_outcome.measure: EQ-5D-5L (EuroQol 5 Dimension 5 Level) Quality of life short-term
secondary_outcome.description: EQ-5D-5L has 5 dimensions and 5 levels from 1 to 5 in each dimension (1 is no problems). It also includes a Visual Analogue scale from 0 to 100 (100 is best possible health). Rating can be transformed to a score with min -0.654 and max (1 is no problems in all dimensions).

secondary_outcome.measure: EQ-5D-5L (EuroQol 5 Dimension 5 Level) Quality of life medium-term
secondary_outcome.description: EQ-5D-5L has 5 dimensions and 5 levels from 1 to 5 in each dimension (1 is no problems). It also includes a Visual Analogue scale from 0 to 100 (100 is best possible health). Rating can be transformed to a score with min -0.654 and max (1 is no problems in all dimensions).

secondary_outcome.measure: EQ-5D-5L (EuroQol 5 Dimension 5 Level) Quality of life long-term
secondary_outcome.description: EQ-5D-5L has 5 dimensions and 5 levels from 1 to 5 in each dimension (1 is no problems). It also includes a Visual Analogue scale from 0 to 100 (100 is best possible health). Rating can be transformed to a score with min -0.654 and max (1 is no problems in all dimensions).
4 items. Min 4, max 28 (28 high competence)

Scale with 9 items, min 0 and max 90. Higher score indicates higher self-efficacy for exercise.

13 items answered two times, one for family and one for friends. Min 13, max 65 (65 highest level of social support)

secondary_outcome.measure: Social Support and Exercise scale (SSES) long-term
secondary_outcome.description: 13 items answered two times, one for family and one for friends. Min 13, max 65 (65 highest level of social support)

secondary_outcome.measure: Users' perspectives on intervention through interviews short-term
secondary_outcome.description: Qualitative data derived from semi-structured interviews with participants.

secondary_outcome.measure: Users' perspectives on intervention through interviews long-term
secondary_outcome.description: Qualitative data derived from semi-structured interviews with participants.

clinical_study.condition: Physical Activity Promotion Among Inactive Adults

arm_group.description: Participants in the group A will be provided the fitness tracker Mi Smart Band 5 with the computational algorithm PAI.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Home training platform and fitness tracker
arm_group.description: Participants in group B will be provided with both the fitness tracker Mi Smart Band 5 with the computational algorithm PAI and access to Les Mills On Demand to perform training classes from home.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Peer support, home training platform and fitness tracker and
arm_group.description: Participants in group C will be offered the fitness tracker Mi Smart Band 5 with the computational algorithm PAI, Les Mills On Demand and additional peer support via social media.

intervention.description: Fitness tracker Mi Smart Band 5 with the computational algorithm PAI
